Articles.Content:
Was just wondering, as I've been having a go with the .mu reader (and having no luck, it's just spitting out errors), has anyone managed to get a model for the new MK2 fuselage standard? It'd be nice to be able to make parts for it.

It should technically be possible to rip any part from the game if the mesh vertices and faces are pulled via plugin to the debug log, then reconstructed into a OBJ file, but that's a really awkward way to do it that I'd rather if it's entirely avoidable.

here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yge19w6bxke9u2z/AADUARA6rVS4QY_rvJDMbWbSa?dl=0

Edited November 1, 2014 by Mach_XXII

I spoke to Taniwha and found the problem. The issue was that Blender 2.63 is not compatible and at least Blender 2.7 (Taniwha uses 2.72) is needed to run the .mu converter.

here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yge19w6bxke9u2z/AADUARA6rVS4QY_rvJDMbWbSa?dl=0

The link might be handy for someone not using the conveter, so thanks for the input!
Download seems to have 404'd. Has this part been moved to a different mod?

18 minutes ago, b0ss said:

Download seems to have 404'd. Has this part been moved to a different mod?

The OP has not visited this forum for some time. Looks like this is defunct.
